details: “Z” is the twenty-sixth and final letter of the modern English alphabet. It represents the /z/ sound, as in 'zebra'. The letter 'Z' is often used in words related to animals, time zones, and the end of things.

wordsData.definition: a large wild animal from Africa with black and white stripes
wordsData.example: The zebra ran across the savanna, blending in with the grass.

wordsData.definition: a fastening device used in clothing and bags that consists of two strips of fabric with interlocking teeth and a sliding mechanism
wordsData.example: She zipped up her jacket to stay warm.

wordsData.definition: a place where animals are kept for the public to view and study
wordsData.example: The children visited the zoo to see the lions and elephants.

wordsData.definition: the number 0, representing nothing or the absence of quantity
wordsData.example: There are zero apples left in the basket.

rhymes.name: Z is for Zebra (to the tune of 'Twinkle, Twinkle, Little Star')
content: Z is for zebra, black and white,
Running through the savanna, what a sight!
With stripes so bold and oh so neat,
Z is for zebra, with four swift feet.

rhymes.name: Z is for Zoo (to the tune of 'If You’re Happy and You Know It')
content: Z is for zoo, where animals play,
You can see lions and bears all day.
From elephants to giraffes so tall,
Z is for zoo, come one, come all!
